title: plagiarism avoidance
original_prompt: In a tone that matches the original text in formality, clarity, detail, and length, rewrite the following text to paraphrase each idea but without plagiarising the original authors.  Be specific and include all information presented.  Include inline citations for ideas from referenced papers.  Also include list of cited refs at end.

input1: The rapid advancement of technology has significantly transformed the landscape of education, enabling more personalized and accessible learning experiences for students (Smith, 2020). Online platforms and digital resources have become essential tools for educators, allowing them to tailor their teaching methods to meet the diverse needs of learners (Johnson & Lee, 2019). Furthermore, the integration of artificial intelligence in educational settings has the potential to enhance student engagement and improve learning outcomes (Brown, 2021).
input2:
Recent developments in technology have profoundly impacted the educational sector, facilitating a shift towards more individualized and accessible learning opportunities for students (Doe, 2020). Digital tools and online resources have emerged as vital components for teachers, empowering them to customize their instructional approaches to accommodate the varied requirements of their students (Williams & Chen, 2018). Additionally, the application of artificial intelligence within educational environments could significantly boost student participation and enhance overall academic performance (Taylor, 2021). 

References: 
- Smith, J. (2020). The impact of technology on education. Journal of Educational Technology, 15(3), 45-60.
- Johnson, A., & Lee, R. (2019). Personalized learning in the digital age. International Journal of Learning, 22(4), 123-135.
- Brown, T. (2021). AI in education: Opportunities and challenges. Educational Review, 29(2), 78-92.
- Doe, J. (2020). Transforming education through technology. Education Today, 18(1), 34-50.
- Williams, S., & Chen, L. (2018). Customizing instruction for diverse learners. Journal of Teaching and Learning, 10(2), 67-80.
- Taylor, M. (2021). Enhancing student engagement with AI. Journal of Educational Research, 25(3), 112-130.
